title: How does Doctrina Christiana symbolizes the Spain's influence to Philippines society during the colonial period? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Doctrina Christiana outlined the teachings of Christianity, with the purpose of propagating Christian teachings throughout the archipelago. It includes basic prayers, the Articles of Faith, the Ten Commandments, the Sacraments of the Holy Church, etc. It’s said to be the first literary printed book in the islands, published in 1593. The Spanish printed the book in Baybayin as well, in order to help spread their doctrine.
